descript.abstract: The Metro Conservation Corridors (MeCC) grow out of the natural resource analysis work done by the DNR in the late '90s, documented in the Metro Greenprint publication (http://files.dnr.state.mn.us/assistance/nrplanning/community/greenways/greenprint.pdf). In 2003 the DNR and the Met Council conducted a follow-up natural resource assessment and created a Regional Significant Ecological Resources data layer (http://deli.dnr.state.mn.us/metadata.html?id=L390002900201). The DNR's regional plant ecologist (Hannah Texler) created the first draft of the MeCC data using the RSEA data and the MCBS data as reference layers, drawing on PRIM maps or digitizing on screen. The corridors have subsequently been refined by the MeCC partners and ecological experts in each county. The data was digitized between 1:24,000 and 1:10,000, using USGS quad maps and the DNR Public Recreation Info Maps (PRIM) for location references.
descript.purpose: To help counties and local governments prioritize areas for conservation and restoration. It's also used by the LCCMR to identify grant locations.
descript.supplinf: Sherburne, Isanti, Chisago, Wright, Anoka, Hennepin, Ramsey, Washington, Carver, Scott, Dakota, Goodhue, Le Sueur counties

timeperd.current: Based on active feedback from the MeCC partners and meeting with the counties.

dataqual.logic: Data are topologically correct using ArcMap 9.2. All polygons are closed and lines intersect where intended
dataqual.complete: Minor changes may occur once a year.

horizpa.horizpar: Source layer ear_meccpy3: 100 meters. This represents a rough estimate of potential ecological corridors, draw on USGS quads and PRIM maps.

enttyp.enttypd: Table containing limited information on the metro Conservation Corridors.

attr.attrdef: Shows if the area is within the Metro Conservation Corridors or not.

distinfo.distliab: The Minnesota Department of Natural Resources General Geographic Data License Agreement is online: http://www.dnr.state.mn.us/sitetools/data_software_license.html

stdorder.ordering: Please visit the download page for this dataset on the Minnesota Geospatial Commons website using the web link below (Online Linkage).
